code.name: code
code.value:
from lfx.base.composio.composio_base import ComposioBaseComponent


class ComposioHeygenAPIComponent(ComposioBaseComponent):
    display_name: str = "Heygen"
    icon = "Heygen"
    documentation: str = "https://docs.composio.dev"
    app_name = "heygen"

    def set_default_tools(self):
        """Set the default tools for Heygen component."""

dimension.info: Custom dimensions for the output video. Must match the aspect ratio of the template.
dimension.name: dimension

generic_api_key.info: Enter API key on Composio page
generic_api_key.name: generic_api_key

tools_metadata.info: Modify tool names and descriptions to help agents understand when to use each tool.
tools_metadata.name: tools_metadata

generation_id.description: The unique identifier of the generation request for the images. Required for AI-generated avatars, optional for uploaded photos
generation_id.title: Generation Id

group_id.description: The unique identifier of the avatar group to which looks will be added. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
group_id.title: Group Id

image_keys.description: Array of image key strings to add to the group. Maximum 4 image keys can be added at a time. Image keys are string identifiers (e.g., 'photo_generation/xxx/yyy.jpg' or 'image/xxx/original') obtained from photo generation or upload responses. If you have objects with 'id' fields, extract the 'id' value as the image key string. This parameter is required.
image_keys.title: Image Keys

image_keys_normalized.description: Please provide a value of type boolean.
image_keys_normalized.title: Image Keys Normalized

name.description: The name identifier for the avatar looks being added. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

value.description: Tool to add additional looks (images) to an existing photo avatar group. Use when you need to expand an avatar group with new image variations. Maximum 4 image keys can be added per request.
value.display_description: Tool to add additional looks (images) to an existing photo avatar group. Use when you need to expand an avatar group with new image variations. Maximum 4 image keys can be added per request.
value.display_name: Add looks to photo avatar group
value.name: HEYGEN_ADD_LOOKS_TO_PHOTO_AVATAR_GROUP

id.description: The unique identifier of the photo avatar to which motion should be applied. This ID can be obtained from photo avatar creation or listing endpoints. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
id.title: Id

value.description: Tool to add natural motion or animation to an existing photo avatar, turning a still image into a moving, lifelike one. Use when you need to animate an avatar or add motion effects to a static photo avatar. The endpoint returns a new ID for the motion-enabled avatar.
value.display_description: Tool to add natural motion or animation to an existing photo avatar, turning a still image into a moving, lifelike one. Use when you need to animate an avatar or add motion effects to a static photo avatar. The endpoint returns a new ID for the motion-enabled avatar.
value.name: HEYGEN_ADD_MOTION

file.description: File to upload as an asset. FileUploadable object where 'name' is the filename. Supported types: image (png, jpeg), video (mp4, webm, mov), or audio (mp3, wav).
file.title: File

value.description: Uploads a new asset (image, video, or audio) to the HeyGen platform. This endpoint allows users to upload media files that can be used in video generation, such as background images, audio tracks, or video clips. The uploaded asset will receive a unique ID that can be used in subsequent API calls (audio_asset_id, image_asset_id, or video_asset_id depending on file type). Use this tool when you need to upload media files to HeyGen for use in content creation.
value.display_description: Uploads a new asset (image, video, or audio) to the HeyGen platform. This endpoint allows users to upload media files that can be used in video generation, such as background images, audio tracks, or video clips. The uploaded asset will receive a unique ID that can be used in subsequent API calls (audio_asset_id, image_asset_id, or video_asset_id depending on file type). Use this tool when you need to upload media files to HeyGen for use in content creation.
value.name: HEYGEN_ADD_NEW_ASSET

generation_id.description: The unique identifier for the photo avatar or look generation job. This ID is obtained from the response of the Generate Photo Avatar Photos endpoint. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
generation_id.title: Generation Id

value.description: Tool to retrieve the current status and details of a photo avatar or look generation by its ID. Use when you need to check if a photo avatar generation is complete or monitor generation progress.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve the current status and details of a photo avatar or look generation by its ID. Use when you need to check if a photo avatar generation is complete or monitor generation progress.
value.name: HEYGEN_CHECK_PHOTO_LOOK_GENERATION_STATUS

name.description: The name of the folder to be created. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

parent_folder_id.description: The ID of the parent folder if creating a nested folder structure. Omit this to create a folder at the root level
parent_folder_id.title: Parent Folder Id

value.description: Tool to create a new folder under your HeyGen account. Use when you need to organize content by creating a new folder. Once created, you can place videos in the folder by providing the folder_id parameter when generating videos.
value.display_description: Tool to create a new folder under your HeyGen account. Use when you need to organize content by creating a new folder. Once created, you can place videos in the folder by providing the folder_id parameter when generating videos.
value.name: HEYGEN_CREATE_FOLDER

name.description: The name of the folder to create. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

value.description: Tool to create a new organization folder in HeyGen. Use when you need to organize content by creating a new folder.
value.display_description: Tool to create a new organization folder in HeyGen. Use when you need to organize content by creating a new folder.
value.name: HEYGEN_CREATE_FOLDER2

name.description: The name/identifier for the knowledge base. Must be a non-empty string. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

opening.description: Initial greeting or opening line that the Interactive Avatar uses when starting a conversation. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: Hello! How can I assist you today?
opening.title: Opening

prompt.description: Custom instructions/system prompt for AI behavior that influences how the avatar responds when using the TALK task type with GPT-4o mini. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: You are a helpful assistant that provides accurate and concise information.
You are a friendly customer support representative.
prompt.title: Prompt

value.description: Tool to create a new knowledge base with a specified name, opening line, and custom prompt for Interactive Avatar streaming sessions. Use when you need to set up a new knowledge base with custom AI behavior.
value.display_description: Tool to create a new knowledge base with a specified name, opening line, and custom prompt for Interactive Avatar streaming sessions. Use when you need to set up a new knowledge base with custom AI behavior.
value.name: HEYGEN_CREATE_KNOWLEDGE_BASE

name.description: The name/identifier for the knowledge base. Must be a non-empty string. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

opening.description: Initial greeting or opening line that the Interactive Avatar uses when starting a conversation. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: Hello! How can I assist you today?
opening.title: Opening

prompt.description: Custom instructions/system prompt for AI behavior that influences how the avatar responds when using the TALK task type with GPT-4o mini. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: You are a helpful assistant that provides accurate and concise information.
You are a friendly customer support representative.
prompt.title: Prompt

value.description: Tool to create a new knowledge base with a specified name, opening line, and custom prompt for Interactive Avatar streaming sessions. Use when you need to set up a new knowledge base with custom AI behavior.
value.display_description: Tool to create a new knowledge base with a specified name, opening line, and custom prompt for Interactive Avatar streaming sessions. Use when you need to set up a new knowledge base with custom AI behavior.
value.name: HEYGEN_CREATE_KNOWLEDGE_BASE2

generation_id.description: ID of the generated photo, used only for AI-generated avatars. Optional parameter that should be provided when creating avatar group from AI-generated photos.
generation_id.title: Generation Id

image_key.description: Reference key for the associated image asset obtained from either uploading an image or generating an AI avatar. Example format: 'image/0be8fa31f9b4406eaab861238f140e3d/original'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
image_key.title: Image Key

name.description: The name identifier for the avatar group being created. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

value.description: Tool to create an avatar group which can include both AI-generated and user-uploaded photos of the avatar. Use when you need to create a new avatar group for training or managing avatar photos.
value.display_description: Tool to create an avatar group which can include both AI-generated and user-uploaded photos of the avatar. Use when you need to create a new avatar group for training or managing avatar photos.
value.name: HEYGEN_CREATE_PHOTO_AVATAR_GROUP

avatar_pose_id.description: Avatar pose ID from List All Avatars (V2) API. This is the avatar_id value that identifies a specific avatar pose. Must be an avatar that supports WebM format. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
avatar_pose_id.title: Avatar Pose Id

avatar_style.description: Avatar style for the video. Common values are 'normal' or 'happy'. Please provide a value of type string.
avatar_style.title: Avatar Style

height.description: Video height in pixels. If not specified, default dimensions will be used
height.title: Height

input_audio.description: Asset ID of uploaded audio file. Alternative to input_text and voice_id. Obtain this ID from the Upload Asset API response
input_audio.title: Input Audio

input_text.description: Text to be spoken by the avatar. Required if input_audio is not provided
examples: Hello, this is a test of the WebM video creation API.
input_text.title: Input Text

voice_id.description: Voice ID from List All Voices (V2) API. Required when using input_text
voice_id.title: Voice Id

width.description: Video width in pixels. If not specified, default dimensions will be used
width.title: Width

value.description: Tool to create a WebM format video with transparent background featuring an avatar speaking text or audio. Use when you need to generate WebM videos with transparent backgrounds for overlaying on other content. Note that this API endpoint does not support custom avatars - only HeyGen's studio avatars are supported. The output format will be WebM instead of MP4 to preserve transparency.
value.display_description: Tool to create a WebM format video with transparent background featuring an avatar speaking text or audio. Use when you need to generate WebM videos with transparent backgrounds for overlaying on other content. Note that this API endpoint does not support custom avatars - only HeyGen's studio avatars are supported. The output format will be WebM instead of MP4 to preserve transparency.
value.name: HEYGEN_CREATE_WEBM_VIDEO

video_id.description: The unique identifier of the video to delete. Supports both generated (avatar) videos and translated videos. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
video_id.title: Video Id

value.description: Tool to delete a video by its ID from HeyGen account. Supports deletion of both generated (avatar) videos and translated videos. Use when you need to remove a video that is no longer required or to manage storage.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a video by its ID from HeyGen account. Supports deletion of both generated (avatar) videos and translated videos. Use when you need to remove a video that is no longer required or to manage storage.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_AN_AVATAR_VIDEO

asset_id.description: The unique identifier of the asset to be deleted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
asset_id.title: Asset Id

value.description: Tool to delete a specific asset by its unique asset ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove an asset (image, video, or audio) that is no longer required.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a specific asset by its unique asset ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove an asset (image, video, or audio) that is no longer required.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_ASSET

asset_id.description: The unique identifier for the asset to be deleted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
asset_id.title: Asset Id

value.description: Tool to delete a specific asset by its unique asset ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove an asset (image, video, or audio) that is no longer required.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a specific asset by its unique asset ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove an asset (image, video, or audio) that is no longer required.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_ASSET2

knowledge_base_id.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base to be deleted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
knowledge_base_id.title: Knowledge Base Id

value.description: Tool to delete a specific knowledge base by its ID. Use when you need to permanently remove a knowledge base from the HeyGen streaming platform.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a specific knowledge base by its ID. Use when you need to permanently remove a knowledge base from the HeyGen streaming platform.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_KNOWLEDGE_BASE

knowledge_base_id.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base to delete. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
knowledge_base_id.title: Knowledge Base Id

value.description: Tool to delete a knowledge base by its unique identifier. Use when you need to permanently remove a specific knowledge base from the HeyGen streaming platform.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a knowledge base by its unique identifier. Use when you need to permanently remove a specific knowledge base from the HeyGen streaming platform.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_KNOWLEDGE_BASE2

avatar_id.description: The unique identifier of the photo avatar to be deleted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
avatar_id.title: Avatar Id

value.description: Tool to delete a photo avatar by its ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove a photo avatar that is no longer required.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a photo avatar by its ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove a photo avatar that is no longer required.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_PHOTO_AVATAR

avatar_group_id.description: The unique identifier of the photo avatar group to be deleted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
avatar_group_id.title: Avatar Group Id

value.description: Tool to delete a photo avatar group by its ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove a photo avatar group that is no longer required.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a photo avatar group by its ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove a photo avatar group that is no longer required.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_PHOTO_AVATAR_GROUP

video_id.description: The ID of the video to delete. Must be at least 32 characters. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
video_id.title: Video Id

value.description: Tool to delete a specific video by its ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove a video that is no longer required. The video_id must be at least 32 characters long.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a specific video by its ID from HeyGen account. Use when you need to remove a video that is no longer required. The video_id must be at least 32 characters long.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_VIDEO

endpoint_id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook endpoint to delete. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
endpoint_id.title: Endpoint Id

value.description: Tool to permanently delete a webhook endpoint from HeyGen. Use when you no longer need to receive webhook notifications for a specific endpoint.
value.display_description: Tool to permanently delete a webhook endpoint from HeyGen. Use when you no longer need to receive webhook notifications for a specific endpoint.
value.name: HEYGEN_DELETE_WEBHOOK_ENDPOINT

age.description: Age group classification for the avatar. Must be one of: 'Young Adult' (18-35), 'Early Middle Age' (35-50), 'Late Middle Age' (50-65), 'Senior' (65+), or 'Unspecified'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
age.title: Age

appearance.description: Detailed description of the avatar's look, attire, and setting. This text prompt guides the AI generation to create specific visual characteristics, clothing, and environmental context. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: A professional young man in business casual attire in a modern office setting
A stylish East Asian Woman in casual attire walking through a bustling city street
appearance.title: Appearance

ethnicity.description: Ethnic background for the avatar. Specifies the ethnic characteristics to be reflected in the avatar. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
ethnicity.title: Ethnicity

gender.description: Gender specification for the avatar. Defines the gender presentation of the generated avatar. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
gender.title: Gender

name.description: Name identifier for the avatar. This is used to identify and track the generated avatar. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
name.title: Name

orientation.description: Layout direction/orientation of the image. Determines the aspect ratio and framing of the generated photo. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
orientation.title: Orientation

pose.description: Body position type for the avatar. Defines how much of the avatar's body is visible in the frame. Valid values: 'half_body', 'close_up', 'full_body'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
pose.title: Pose

style.description: Visual aesthetic style for rendering. Determines the artistic style of the generated avatar. Valid values: 'Realistic', 'Pixar', 'Cinematic', 'Vintage', 'Noir', 'Cyberpunk', 'Unspecified'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
style.title: Style

value.description: Tool to generate a personalized AI avatar based on text prompts and attribute inputs. Use when you need to create custom AI-generated avatar photos with specific characteristics like age, gender, ethnicity, pose, and appearance details.
value.display_description: Tool to generate a personalized AI avatar based on text prompts and attribute inputs. Use when you need to create custom AI-generated avatar photos with specific characteristics like age, gender, ethnicity, pose, and appearance details.
value.name: HEYGEN_GENERATE_PHOTO_AVATAR_PHOTOS

text.description: Sample text to synthesize into audio. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: Hello, this is a test preview of the HeyGen voice API.
text.title: Text

text_type.description: Specifies input format. Accepted values: 'text' or 'ssml'. Defaults to 'text' if not specified. Please provide a value of type string.
text_type.title: Text Type

voice_id.description: Identifier for the voice to use in the preview. Can be retrieved from the List All Voices (V2) endpoint. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
voice_id.title: Voice Id

value.description: Tool to generate a short audio preview with the specified voice and text. Use when you need to synthesize short audio clips using selected voices before creating full videos. This is an Enterprise-only feature that consumes API credits and is currently in Beta.
value.display_description: Tool to generate a short audio preview with the specified voice and text. Use when you need to synthesize short audio clips using selected voices before creating full videos. This is an Enterprise-only feature that consumes API credits and is currently in Beta.
value.name: HEYGEN_GENERATE_VOICE_AUDIO_PREVIEW

avatar_id.description: The unique identifier for the specific avatar. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
avatar_id.title: Avatar Id

value.description: Tool to retrieve specific avatar details by avatar ID. Use when you need to get detailed information about a particular avatar including type, name, gender, preview URLs, premium status, and associated tags.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve specific avatar details by avatar ID. Use when you need to get detailed information about a particular avatar including type, name, gender, preview URLs, premium status, and associated tags.
value.name: HEYGEN_GET_AVATAR

value.description: Tool to retrieve the profile information of the currently authenticated user. Use when you need to fetch user details including username, email, full name, subscription status, and quotas.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve the profile information of the currently authenticated user. Use when you need to fetch user details including username, email, full name, subscription status, and quotas.
value.name: HEYGEN_GET_CURRENT_USER_INFORMATION

group_id.description: The unique identifier of the avatar group whose training status is being queried. This ID is obtained when creating a training job. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
group_id.title: Group Id

value.description: Tool to retrieve the current training status and details of a photo avatar training job by group ID. Use when you need to check training progress, monitor job completion, or verify if training has finished successfully.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve the current training status and details of a photo avatar training job by group ID. Use when you need to check training progress, monitor job completion, or verify if training has finished successfully.
value.name: HEYGEN_GET_TRAINING_JOB_STATUS

group_id.description: The unique identifier of the photo avatar group whose training status is being queried. This ID is obtained when creating a photo avatar training job. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
group_id.title: Group Id

value.description: Tool to retrieve the current training status and details of a photo avatar training job by group ID. Use when you need to check training progress or verify if training has completed successfully.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve the current training status and details of a photo avatar training job by group ID. Use when you need to check training progress or verify if training has completed successfully.
value.name: HEYGEN_GET_TRAINING_STATUS

session_id.description: A unique identifier for the streaming session to keep alive. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
session_id.title: Session Id

value.description: Tool to reset the idle timeout counter for an active streaming session. Use when you need to prevent a streaming session from timing out during periods of inactivity.
value.display_description: Tool to reset the idle timeout counter for an active streaming session. Use when you need to prevent a streaming session from timing out during periods of inactivity.
value.name: HEYGEN_KEEP_ALIVE_STREAMING_SESSION

value.description: Tool to retrieve a list of all available avatar groups in your HeyGen account. Use when you need to fetch all avatar groups for content management or selection purposes.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a list of all available avatar groups in your HeyGen account. Use when you need to fetch all avatar groups for content management or selection purposes.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_ALL_AVATAR_GROUPS

group_id.description: The unique identifier for the specific avatar group from which to retrieve avatars. This ID can be obtained from the HeyGen dashboard or from other group-related endpoints. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
group_id.title: Group Id

value.description: Tool to retrieve all avatars that belong to a specific avatar group. Use when you need to fetch all avatars within a particular group for content management or selection purposes.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve all avatars that belong to a specific avatar group. Use when you need to fetch all avatars within a particular group for content management or selection purposes.
value.display_name: List all avatars in one avatar group
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_ALL_AVATARS_IN_ONE_AVATAR_GROUP

value.description: Tool to retrieve available locales for multilingual voices. Use when you need to access locale identifiers that can be used with multilingual voices for video generation.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve available locales for multilingual voices. Use when you need to access locale identifiers that can be used with multilingual voices for video generation.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_ALL_LOCALES_FOR_VOICES

file_type.description: Filter assets by type. Possible values: 'image', 'video', 'audio'
file_type.title: File Type

folder_id.description: Filter assets by parent folder ID to retrieve assets from specific folder
folder_id.title: Folder Id

limit.description: Maximum number of assets to return per page (controls page size for pagination)
limit.title: Limit

token.description: Cursor token for pagination. Use the token returned from previous response to fetch next page of results
token.title: Token

value.description: Tool to retrieve a paginated list of all assets (images, audios, videos) created under your account. Use when you need to fetch assets for content management or track uploaded resources. Supports filtering by file type and folder, as well as cursor-based pagination.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a paginated list of all assets (images, audios, videos) created under your account. Use when you need to fetch assets for content management or track uploaded resources. Supports filtering by file type and folder, as well as cursor-based pagination.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_ASSETS

file_type.description: Filter assets by file type. Common values include 'image', 'video', 'audio'. Leave empty to retrieve all asset types
file_type.title: File Type

folder_id.description: Filter assets by parent folder ID. Specify a folder ID to retrieve only assets within that specific folder. Omit to get assets from all folders
folder_id.title: Folder Id

limit.description: Maximum number of assets to return per page for pagination. Controls the page size
limit.title: Limit

page.description: Page number for pagination. Use to navigate through multiple pages of results. Start from 1 for the first page
page.title: Page

value.description: Tool to retrieve a list of uploaded assets (images, videos, audios) from your HeyGen account. Use when you need to access or manage your uploaded media resources. Supports filtering by file type and folder, with page-based or cursor-based pagination options.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a list of uploaded assets (images, videos, audios) from your HeyGen account. Use when you need to access or manage your uploaded media resources. Supports filtering by file type and folder, with page-based or cursor-based pagination options.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_ASSETS2

value.description: Tool to retrieve a list of brand glossaries created under your account. Use when you need to access brand voice definitions that maintain consistent terminology and pronunciation across videos.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a list of brand glossaries created under your account. Use when you need to access brand voice definitions that maintain consistent terminology and pronunciation across videos.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_BRAND_VOICES

token.description: Cursor token for pagination. For the first request, omit this parameter. For subsequent requests, use the token value returned in the previous response to get the next page of results. When the token is empty or null in the response, it indicates there are no more pages
token.title: Token

value.description: Tool to retrieve a paginated list of folders created under your account. Use when you need to organize or browse folder structures in HeyGen. Supports cursor-based pagination using the token parameter.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a paginated list of folders created under your account. Use when you need to organize or browse folder structures in HeyGen. Supports cursor-based pagination using the token parameter.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_FOLDERS

group_id.description: The unique identifier for the specific avatar group from which to retrieve avatars. This ID can be obtained from the HeyGen dashboard or from other group-related endpoints. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
group_id.title: Group Id

value.description: Tool to retrieve all avatars that belong to a specific avatar group. Use when you need to fetch all avatars within a particular group for content management or selection purposes.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve all avatars that belong to a specific avatar group. Use when you need to fetch all avatars within a particular group for content management or selection purposes.
value.display_name: List avatars in a specific group
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_GROUP_AVATARS

value.description: Tool to retrieve a list of all existing knowledge bases associated with your account. Use when you need to view available knowledge bases for streaming interactions.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a list of all existing knowledge bases associated with your account. Use when you need to view available knowledge bases for streaming interactions.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_KNOWLEDGE_BASES

value.description: Tool to retrieve a list of all knowledge bases associated with your account. Use when you need to view available knowledge bases for streaming interactions.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a list of all knowledge bases associated with your account. Use when you need to view available knowledge bases for streaming interactions.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_KNOWLEDGE_BASES2

value.description: Tool to retrieve a list of public and custom interactive avatars for streaming. Use when you need to fetch available avatars for interactive streaming sessions.
value.display_description: Tool to retrieve a list of public and custom interactive avatars for streaming. Use when you need to fetch available avatars for interactive streaming sessions.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_STREAMING_AVATARS

value.description: Tool to list available streaming avatars for interactive sessions. Use when you need to retrieve the collection of avatars that can be used for streaming.
value.display_description: Tool to list available streaming avatars for interactive sessions. Use when you need to retrieve the collection of avatars that can be used for streaming.
value.name: HEYGEN_LIST_STREAMING_AVATARS2

activity_idle_timeout.description: Maximum idle seconds after last activity. Range: 30-3600 seconds. Default: 120 seconds.
activity_idle_timeout.title: Activity Idle Timeout

avatar_id.description: Interactive Avatar ID. Defaults to 'default' if omitted. Use to specify which avatar to use for the streaming session.
avatar_id.title: Avatar Id

disable_idle_timeout.description: Disables the default 2-minute idle timeout when set to true. Useful for long-running sessions.
disable_idle_timeout.title: Disable Idle Timeout

knowledge_base.description: Knowledge Base prompt for chat tasks. Provides context for avatar responses.
knowledge_base.title: Knowledge Base

knowledge_base_id.description: Knowledge base ID for avatar responses. Requires version='v2' to be set.
knowledge_base_id.title: Knowledge Base Id

quality.description: Data quality level - 'high' (2000kbps/720p), 'medium' (1000kbps/480p), or 'low' (500kbps/360p). Required parameter. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
quality.title: Quality

version.description: API version. Valid value is 'v2' (beta). Use this to access v2-specific features.
version.title: Version

video_encoding.description: Video format encoding - 'H264' or 'VP8'. Defaults to VP8 if not specified.
video_encoding.title: Video Encoding

value.description: This endpoint allows you to add one or more contacts to a specific personalized video project in the Heygen platform. It is used when you need to associate individual contact information with a project, likely for the purpose of creating tailored video content for each contact. The endpoint accepts a project identifier and a list of contacts, each with a first name and email address. This tool is essential for populating your project with recipient data, enabling the creation of personalized videos at scale. Note that this endpoint only adds contacts to a project; it does not initiate video creation or sending. Ensure that your project_id is valid and that all contact information is accurate to avoid errors in video personalization or delivery.

Ensure that your project_id is valid and that all contact information is accurate to avoid errors in video personalization or delivery.

value.description: Retrieves detailed status and information about a specific video by its ID. This endpoint returns the current status of the video generation process along with URLs to access the video, thumbnail, GIF preview, and captions. The video URLs are time-limited and expire after 7 days, but the video itself does not expire - you can call this endpoint again to get fresh URLs. Use this tool to check if a video has completed processing, retrieve its playback URL, or get error information if the generation failed.

This endpoint generates a unique, time-limited token that authenticates and authorizes access to HeyGen's streaming capabilities. Use this endpoint when initiating a new streaming session or when the previous token has expired. The generated token is typically for one-time use and should be obtained shortly before starting a streaming interaction. Note that this endpoint does not initiate the streaming itself; it only provides the necessary credentials for subsequent streaming API calls.

value.description: This endpoint is used to submit ICE (Interactive Connectivity Establishment) candidate information for a specific streaming session in the Heygen platform. It plays a crucial role in establishing and managing peer-to-peer connections for real-time communication and streaming of avatar content. The endpoint should be called when new ICE candidates are discovered during the connection setup process, typically as part of the WebRTC negotiation. It's essential for ensuring optimal connectivity between clients, especially in scenarios involving NAT traversal or complex network environments. This endpoint does not return the status of the connection or initiate the streaming itself; it only submits candidate information to be used in the connection process.

It's essential for ensuring optimal connectivity between clients, especially in scenarios involving NAT traversal or complex network environments. value.description: Interrupts an ongoing streaming session with an interactive avatar. This endpoint allows immediate termination of the avatar's current action or speech, providing control over the flow of interaction. Use this when you need to abruptly stop the avatar's current behavior, such as when changing topics or responding to user input that requires a different response. The interruption is immediate and irreversible, so use it judiciously to maintain a smooth user experience. This endpoint is particularly useful in scenarios where real-time responsiveness is crucial, like in customer service applications or interactive presentations.

It requires a unique session ID and a Session Description Protocol (SDP) offer to establish the connection. This endpoint should be called when starting a new interactive session with a HeyGen AI avatar or when initiating a live streaming event. It's crucial for setting up the initial parameters of the real-time communication channel.

value.description: The streaming.stop endpoint is used to terminate an active streaming session in the Heygen API. This endpoint should be called when you want to end a real-time data transfer session, such as when closing an interactive avatar conversation or stopping a live content stream. It's particularly useful for freeing up server resources and ensuring proper closure of streaming connections. The endpoint requires the unique session_id to identify which specific session to stop, allowing for precise control over multiple concurrent sessions. Note that once a session is stopped, it cannot be resumed; a new session must be started if streaming is needed again.

Note that once a session is stopped, it cannot be resumed; a new session must be started if streaming is needed again.

Note that this endpoint requires an active streaming session, and the avatar's voice and appearance are determined by the session configuration.

add_label_ids.description: IMPORTANT: Label IDs are NOT the same as label names shown in Gmail UI. MODIFIABLE SYSTEM LABELS (use these exact IDs): INBOX, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD, STARRED, IMPORTANT, CATEGORY_PERSONAL, CATEGORY_SOCIAL, CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS, CATEGORY_UPDATES, CATEGORY_FORUMS. Note: 'UPDATES', 'SOCIAL', 'PROMOTIONS', 'FORUMS', 'PERSONAL' are INVALID - you must use the full CATEGORY_ prefix (e.g., 'CATEGORY_UPDATES' not 'UPDATES'). CUSTOM LABELS: You MUST call 'listLabels' action first to get the label ID (format: 'Label_<number>', e.g., 'Label_1', 'Label_123'). Do NOT use the label name displayed in Gmail UI - the API requires the ID, not the name. Example: if listLabels returns {"id": "Label_5", "name": "Work Projects"}, use 'Label_5' (NOT 'Work Projects'). IMMUTABLE LABELS (cannot be added or removed): SENT, DRAFT, and CHAT are system labels managed by Gmail and cannot be modified via the API. Attempting to use these will return 'Invalid label' errors. A label cannot appear in both add_label_ids and remove_label_ids. At least one of 'add_label_ids' or 'remove_label_ids' must be non-empty.
add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids

message_id.description: Immutable ID of the message to modify. Gmail message IDs are 15-16 character hexadecimal strings (e.g., '1a2b3c4d5e6f7890'). IMPORTANT: Do NOT use UUIDs (32-character strings like '093ca4662b214d5eba8f4ceeaad63433'), thread IDs, or internal system IDs - these will cause 'Invalid id value' errors. Obtain valid message IDs from: (1) 'GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS' response 'messageId' field, (2) 'GMAIL_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_THREAD_ID' response, or (3) 'GMAIL_LIST_THREADS' and then fetching thread messages. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
message_id.title: Message Id

remove_label_ids.description: IMPORTANT: Label IDs are NOT the same as label names shown in Gmail UI. MODIFIABLE SYSTEM LABELS (use these exact IDs): INBOX, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD, STARRED, IMPORTANT, CATEGORY_PERSONAL, CATEGORY_SOCIAL, CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS, CATEGORY_UPDATES, CATEGORY_FORUMS. Note: 'UPDATES', 'SOCIAL', 'PROMOTIONS', 'FORUMS', 'PERSONAL' are INVALID - you must use the full CATEGORY_ prefix (e.g., 'CATEGORY_UPDATES' not 'UPDATES'). CUSTOM LABELS: You MUST call 'listLabels' action first to get the label ID (format: 'Label_<number>', e.g., 'Label_1', 'Label_123'). Do NOT use the label name displayed in Gmail UI - the API requires the ID, not the name. IMMUTABLE LABELS (cannot be added or removed): SENT, DRAFT, and CHAT are system labels managed by Gmail and cannot be modified via the API. Attempting to use these will return 'Invalid label' errors. Common operations: to mark as read, REMOVE 'UNREAD'; to archive, REMOVE 'INBOX'. A label cannot appear in both add_label_ids and remove_label_ids. At least one of 'add_label_ids' or 'remove_label_ids' must be non-empty.
remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids

addLabelIds.description: List of label IDs to add to the messages. IMPORTANT: Use label IDs, NOT label display names. System labels use their name as ID: INBOX, STARRED, IMPORTANT, SENT, DRAFT, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD, CATEGORY_PERSONAL, CATEGORY_SOCIAL, CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS, CATEGORY_UPDATES, CATEGORY_FORUMS. Custom labels MUST use their ID (format: 'Label_XXX', e.g., 'Label_1', 'Label_25'), NOT the display name (e.g., do NOT use 'Work' or 'Projects'). Call GMAIL_LIST_LABELS first to get the 'id' field for custom labels. At least one of add_label_ids or remove_label_ids must be provided. CONSTRAINT: Label IDs must NOT overlap with remove_label_ids - cannot add and remove the same label.
addLabelIds.title: Addlabelids

messageIds.description: List of message IDs to modify. Maximum 1,000 message IDs per request. Get message IDs from GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS or GMAIL_LIST_THREADS actions. Accepts 'messageIds', 'ids', or 'message_ids' as the parameter name. This parameter is required.
messageIds.title: Messageids

removeLabelIds.description: List of label IDs to remove from the messages. IMPORTANT: Use label IDs, NOT label display names. System labels use their name as ID: INBOX, STARRED, IMPORTANT, SENT, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD. Custom labels MUST use their ID (format: 'Label_XXX', e.g., 'Label_1', 'Label_25'), NOT the display name (e.g., do NOT use 'Work' or 'Projects'). Call GMAIL_LIST_LABELS first to get the 'id' field for custom labels. Common use cases: Remove 'UNREAD' to mark as read, remove 'INBOX' to archive. Note: 'DRAFT' cannot be removed - use GMAIL_DELETE_DRAFT instead. At least one of add_label_ids or remove_label_ids must be provided. CONSTRAINT: Label IDs must NOT overlap with add_label_ids - cannot add and remove the same label.
removeLabelIds.title: Removelabelids

attachment.description: File to attach to the email.
attachment.title: Attachment

bcc.description: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) recipients' email addresses. Each must be a valid email address (e.g., 'user@example.com') or display name format (e.g., 'Bob Jones <user@example.com>'). Plain names without email addresses are NOT valid. Optional for drafts (recipients can be added later before sending).
bcc.title: Bcc

body.description: Email body content (plain text or HTML); `is_html` must be True if HTML. Optional - drafts can be created without a body and edited later before sending. Can also be provided as 'message_body'.
examples:
Hello Team,

Please find the attached report for your review.

Best regards,
Your Name

Meeting Confirmation

This email confirms our meeting scheduled for next Tuesday.
body.title: Body

cc.description: Carbon Copy (CC) recipients' email addresses. Each must be a valid email address (e.g., 'user@example.com') or display name format (e.g., 'John Doe <user@example.com>'). Plain names without email addresses are NOT valid. Optional for drafts (recipients can be added later before sending).
cc.title: Cc

extra_recipients.description: Additional 'To' recipients' email addresses (not Cc or Bcc). Each must be a valid email address (e.g., 'user@example.com'), display name format (e.g., 'Jane Doe <user@example.com>'), or 'me' for the authenticated user. Plain names without email addresses are NOT valid. Should only be used if recipient_email is also provided.
extra_recipients.title: Extra Recipients

is_html.description:
Set to True if `body` is already formatted HTML. When False, plain text newlines are auto-converted to
tags. Both modes result in HTML email; this flag controls whether the body content is treated as raw HTML or plain text that gets HTML formatting applied. Please provide a value of type boolean.
is_html.title: Is Html

recipient_email.description: Primary recipient's email address. Must be a valid email address (e.g., 'user@example.com') or display name format (e.g., 'John Doe <user@example.com>'). A plain name without an email address (e.g., 'John Doe') is NOT valid - the '@' symbol and domain are required. Optional for drafts (recipients can be added later before sending). Use extra_recipients if you want to send to multiple recipients.
recipient_email.title: Recipient Email

subject.description: Email subject line. Optional - drafts can be created without a subject and edited later before sending. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave this empty to stay in the same thread. Setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.
subject.title: Subject

thread_id.description: ID of an existing Gmail thread to reply to; omit for new thread. If the thread ID is invalid or inaccessible, the draft will be created as a new thread instead of failing.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user. Please provide a value of type string.
user_id.title: User Id

value.description: Creates a Gmail email draft. All fields are optional per the Gmail API - drafts can be created with minimal content and edited later before sending. Supports To/Cc/Bcc recipients, subject, plain/HTML body (ensure `is_html=True` for HTML), attachments, and threading. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave subject empty to stay in the same thread; setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.
value.display_description: Creates a Gmail email draft. All fields are optional per the Gmail API - drafts can be created with minimal content and edited later before sending. Supports To/Cc/Bcc recipients, subject, plain/HTML body (ensure `is_html=True` for HTML), attachments, and threading. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave subject empty to stay in the same thread; setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.
value.name: GMAIL_CREATE_EMAIL_DRAFT

background_color.description: Background color for the label. Gmail only accepts colors from a predefined palette of 102 specific hex values. Common color names like 'YELLOW', 'RED', 'BLUE', 'GREEN', 'ORANGE', 'PURPLE', 'PINK' are automatically mapped to the closest Gmail palette color. Provide either a common color name, a Gmail palette color name (e.g., 'ROYAL_BLUE', 'CARIBBEAN_GREEN'), or exact hex value (e.g., '#4a86e8', '#43d692'). If only background_color is provided without text_color, a complementary text color (white or black) will be auto-selected for optimal contrast. Full palette: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/reference/rest/v1/users.labels#Color
background_color.title: Background Color

label_list_visibility.description: Controls how the label is displayed in the label list in the Gmail sidebar. Valid values: 'labelShow' (always show), 'labelShowIfUnread' (show only if unread messages), 'labelHide' (hide from list). Please provide a value of type string.
label_list_visibility.title: Label List Visibility

label_name.description: REQUIRED. The name for the new label. Must be unique within the account, non-blank, maximum length 225 characters, cannot contain commas (','), not only whitespace, and must not be a reserved system label. Reserved English system labels include: Inbox, Starred, Important, Sent, Draft, Drafts, Spam, Trash, etc. Forward slashes ('/') are allowed and used to create hierarchical nested labels (e.g., 'Work/Projects', 'Personal/Finance'). When creating nested labels, any missing parent labels will be automatically created (similar to 'mkdir -p'). Periods ('.') are allowed and commonly used for numbering schemes (e.g., '1. Action Items', '2. Projects'). Note: 'name' is also accepted as an alias for this field. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
label_name.title: Label Name

message_list_visibility.description: Controls how messages with this label are displayed in the message list. Valid values: 'show' or 'hide'. Note: These values are different from label_list_visibility - do NOT use 'labelShow' or 'labelHide' here. Please provide a value of type string.
message_list_visibility.title: Message List Visibility

text_color.description: Text color for the label. Gmail only accepts colors from a predefined palette of 102 specific hex values. Common color names like 'YELLOW', 'RED', 'BLUE', 'GREEN', 'ORANGE', 'PURPLE', 'PINK' are automatically mapped to the closest Gmail palette color. Provide either a common color name, a Gmail palette color name (e.g., 'BLACK', 'ROYAL_BLUE'), or exact hex value (e.g., '#000000', '#4a86e8'). If only text_color is provided without background_color, a complementary background color (white or black) will be auto-selected for optimal contrast. Full palette: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/reference/rest/v1/users.labels#Color
text_color.title: Text Color

label_id.description: ID of the user-created label to be permanently DELETED from the account. Must be a custom label ID (format: 'Label_<id>' e.g., 'Label_1', 'Label_42'). System labels (INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, UNREAD, STARRED, IMPORTANT, SPAM, TRASH, CATEGORY_*, etc.) cannot be deleted. WARNING: This action permanently DELETES the label definition from your account - it does NOT remove a label from a message. To add/remove labels from messages, use GMAIL_ADD_LABEL_TO_EMAIL instead. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

System labels (INBOX, SENT, UNREAD, etc.) cannot be deleted. To add/remove labels from specific messages, use GMAIL_ADD_LABEL_TO_EMAIL action instead.
value.display_description: Permanently DELETES a user-created Gmail label from the account (not from a message). WARNING: This action DELETES the label definition itself, removing it from all messages. System labels (INBOX, SENT, UNREAD, etc.) cannot be deleted. To add/remove labels from specific messages, use GMAIL_ADD_LABEL_TO_EMAIL action instead.
value.name: GMAIL_DELETE_LABEL

include_payload.description: Set to true to include full message payload (headers, body, attachments); false for metadata only. Please provide a value of type boolean.

include_spam_trash.description: Set to true to include messages from 'SPAM' and 'TRASH'. Please provide a value of type boolean.
include_spam_trash.title: Include Spam Trash

label_ids.description: Filter by label IDs; only messages with all specified labels are returned. System label IDs (can be used directly): 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'TRASH', 'UNREAD', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT', 'CATEGORY_PRIMARY' (alias 'CATEGORY_PERSONAL'), 'CATEGORY_SOCIAL', 'CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS', 'CATEGORY_UPDATES', 'CATEGORY_FORUMS'. IMPORTANT: For custom/user-created labels, you MUST use the label ID (e.g., 'Label_123456'), NOT the label name shown in Gmail UI. For example, if you have a label named 'BlocksToDo' in Gmail, you cannot pass 'BlocksToDo' - you must first call the 'listLabels' action to find the corresponding ID (something like 'Label_7890') and use that ID here. Passing a label name instead of ID for custom labels will result in an 'Invalid label' error.
label_ids.title: Label Ids

query.description: Gmail advanced search query (e.g., 'from:user subject:meeting'). Supported operators: 'from:', 'to:', 'subject:', 'label:', 'has:', 'is:', 'in:', 'category:', 'after:YYYY/MM/DD', 'before:YYYY/MM/DD', AND/OR/NOT. IMPORTANT - 'is:' vs 'label:' usage: Use 'is:' for special mail states: is:snoozed, is:unread, is:read, is:starred, is:important. Use 'label:' ONLY for user-created labels (e.g., 'label:work', 'label:projects'). Note: 'muted' may work with both 'is:muted' and 'label:muted' based on community reports. Common mistake: 'label:snoozed' is WRONG - use 'is:snoozed' instead. Use quotes for exact phrases. Omit for no query filter.
query.title: Query

Custom labels use the format 'Label_N' (e.g., 'Label_1', 'Label_42'). Use GMAIL_LIST_LABELS to discover available label IDs. Accepts either a list or a JSON-encoded string. code.name: code
code.value:
from typing import Any

from lfx.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from lfx.custom.custom_component.component import Component
from lfx.inputs.input_mixin import FieldTypes
from lfx.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from lfx.io import BoolInput, MessageTextInput, Output, PromptInput
from lfx.log.logger import logger
from lfx.schema.dotdict import dotdict
from lfx.schema.message import Message
from lfx.template.utils import update_template_values
from lfx.utils.mustache_security import validate_mustache_template


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt Template"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/components-prompts"
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt Template"
    priority = 0  # Set priority to 0 to make it appear first

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
        BoolInput(
            name="use_double_brackets",
            display_name="Use Double Brackets",
            value=False,
            advanced=True,
            info="Use {{variable}} syntax instead of {variable}.",
            real_time_refresh=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="tool_placeholder",
            display_name="Tool Placeholder",
            tool_mode=True,
            advanced=True,
            info="A placeholder input for tool mode.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: Any, field_name: str | None = None) -> dotdict:
        """Update the template field type based on the selected mode."""
        if field_name == "use_double_brackets":
            # Change the template field type based on mode
            is_mustache = field_value is True
            if is_mustache:
                build_config["template"]["type"] = FieldTypes.MUSTACHE_PROMPT.value
            else:
                build_config["template"]["type"] = FieldTypes.PROMPT.value

            # Re-process the template to update variables when mode changes
            template_value = build_config.get("template", {}).get("value", "")
            if template_value:
                # Ensure custom_fields is properly initialized
                if "custom_fields" not in build_config:
                    build_config["custom_fields"] = {}

                # Clean up fields from the OLD mode before processing with NEW mode
                # This ensures we don't keep fields with wrong syntax even if validation fails
                old_custom_fields = build_config["custom_fields"].get("template", [])
                for old_field in list(old_custom_fields):
                    # Remove the field from custom_fields and template
                    if old_field in old_custom_fields:
                        old_custom_fields.remove(old_field)
                    build_config.pop(old_field, None)

                # Try to process template with new mode to add new variables
                # If validation fails, at least we cleaned up old fields
                try:
                    # Validate mustache templates for security
                    if is_mustache:
                        validate_mustache_template(template_value)

                    # Re-process template with new mode to add new variables
                    _ = process_prompt_template(
                        template=template_value,
                        name="template",
                        custom_fields=build_config["custom_fields"],
                        frontend_node_template=build_config,
                        is_mustache=is_mustache,
                    )
                except ValueError as e:
                    # If validation fails, we still updated the mode and cleaned old fields
                    # User will see error when they try to save
                    logger.debug(f"Template validation failed during mode switch: {e}")
        return build_config

    async def build_prompt(self) -> Message:
        use_double_brackets = self.use_double_brackets if hasattr(self, "use_double_brackets") else False
        template_format = "mustache" if use_double_brackets else "f-string"
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(template_format=template_format, **self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        use_double_brackets = frontend_node["template"].get("use_double_brackets", {}).get("value", False)
        is_mustache = use_double_brackets is True

        try:
            # Validate mustache templates for security
            if is_mustache:
                validate_mustache_template(prompt_template)

            custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
            frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
            _ = process_prompt_template(
                template=prompt_template,
                name="template",
                custom_fields=custom_fields,
                frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
                is_mustache=is_mustache,
            )
        except ValueError as e:
            # If validation fails, don't add variables but allow component to be created
            logger.debug(f"Template validation failed in _update_template: {e}")
        return frontend_node

    async def update_frontend_node(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """This function is called after the code validation is done."""
        frontend_node = await super().update_frontend_node(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        use_double_brackets = frontend_node["template"].get("use_double_brackets", {}).get("value", False)
        is_mustache = use_double_brackets is True

        try:
            # Validate mustache templates for security
            if is_mustache:
                validate_mustache_template(template)

            # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
            _ = process_prompt_template(
                template=template,
                name="template",
                custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
                frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
                is_mustache=is_mustache,
            )
        except ValueError as e:
            # If validation fails, don't add variables but allow component to be updated
            logger.debug(f"Template validation failed in update_frontend_node: {e}")
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)

template.value:
You are a Support Video Script Writer for a platform. You have access to Gmail and a knowledge base.

YOUR TASK:
1. Scan emails in the inbox for user questions about the platform
2. Search the knowledge base for the answer using the Chroma tool
3. Create a video script explaining how to solve the question

PROCESS:
1. Read the support email and identify the main question
2. Use Chroma to search the knowledge base for relevant documentation
3. Write a clear video script (100-150 words) based on the information found

OUTPUT FORMAT (provide ONLY this):

---
VIDEO_SCRIPT:
[Write the complete script here as if you're explaining to the user in a video]

SUBJECT_LINE: [5-7 word summary for email subject]

---

SCRIPT REQUIREMENTS:
- 100-150 words maximum
- Conversational, friendly tone
- Structure: Greeting → Understand the question → Step-by-step solution → Closing
- Use simple language
- Include specific steps from the knowledge base
- Sound natural when read aloud (60-90 seconds)

EXAMPLE SCRIPT:
"Hi! I saw you're having trouble generating an API Key on the platform.

Let me walk you through the process step by step.

First, log into your account and go to Settings in the top menu. Then click on 'API & Integrations' in the left sidebar. You'll see a button that says 'Generate New API Key' - click on that.

The platform will create your unique API key and show it on the screen. Make sure to copy it immediately and store it somewhere safe, because for security reasons, you won't be able to see it again.

If you need to create multiple keys for different projects, just repeat this process. Each key can be named so you can identify them later.

That's it! Let me know if you need any help."
